term.name: relativism
term.source: From English relative: depending on or determined by a relationship between two entities; not independent.
term.def: The view (opposed to &objectivism; and &realism;) that truth and value are relative to an observer or group of observers. One example is cultural relativism, which claims that different cultures have different but perfectly legitimate and equally valid standards of truth and value (see &polylogism; and &postmodernism;). Relativism is often another word for &subjectivism;, although the latter term is more personal and does not generally refer to social forms of relativism.
